numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I have seen that the chance of a person to get into a better legacy school increases with the income of the parents of the person.
2. I wonder why it matters whether the parents of a person are wealthy or not.
3. Some people received the same test results.
4. If all these people received the same test results, then all these people ought to have an equal opportunity.
5. This issue is relevant to me.
6. This issue is relevant to my community.
8. Some underprivileged individuals wish to enroll in a college.
9. The parents of these underprivileged individuals attended this college.
10. Some underprivileged individuals score highly on exams.
11. Some underprivileged individuals are unable to enroll in this college.
